results.definition: the content of cognition; the main thing you are thinking about
examples: it was not a good idea
the thought never entered my mind

results.definition: the process of using your mind to consider something carefully
examples: thinking always made him frown
she paused for thought

results.definition: the organized beliefs of a period or group or individual
examples: 19th century thought
Darwinian thought

results.definition: a personal belief or judgment that is not founded on proof or certainty
examples: my opinion differs from yours
I am not of your persuasion
what are your thoughts on Haiti?

results.definition: judge or regard; look upon; judge
examples: I think he is very smart
I believe her to be very smart
I think that he is her boyfriend
The racist conceives such people to be inferior
I imagine she earned a lot of money with her new novel
I thought to find her in a bad state
he didn't think to find her in the kitchen
I guess she is angry at me for standing her up

results.definition: use or exercise the mind or one's power of reason in order to make inferences, decisions, or arrive at a solution or judgments
examples: I've been thinking all day and getting nowhere

results.definition: recall knowledge from memory; have a recollection
examples: I can't remember saying any such thing
I can't think what her last name was
can you remember her phone number?
Do you remember that he once loved you?
call up memories
Just think--you could be rich one day!
Think what a scene it must have been!

results.definition: focus one's attention on a certain state
examples: Think big
think thin

results.definition: have in mind as a purpose
examples: I mean no harm
I only meant to help you
She didn't think to harm me
We thought to return early that night

results.definition: decide by pondering, reasoning, or reflecting
examples: Can you think what to do next?

results.definition: ponder; reflect on, or reason about
examples: Think the matter through
Think how hard life in Russia must be these days

results.definition: dispose the mind in a certain way
examples: Do you really think so?

results.definition: have or formulate in the mind
examples: think good thoughts
Man is the only creature that thinks

results.definition: bring into a given condition by mental preoccupation
examples: She thought herself into a state of panic over the final exam
